intro: Succowia echinata, commonly known as the spiny pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, globular inflorescence. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Succowia echinata is a succulent, meaning it stores water in its thick, fleshy leaves and stems. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
